DOCNAME: WILKINSON and KNOTT v. the UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and PERSON , are GPE nationals . They were born in DATE and DATE and are from GPE and GPE , respectively . They were represented before the ORG by Mr G. Blades , a lawyer practising in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows . Both applicants were convicted and sentenced by courts - martial convened following the entry into force of LAW .

In DATE Mr PERSON was convicted by an air - force district court - martial of conduct to the prejudice of good order and air force discipline . He was fined of MONEY ( “ GBP ” ) . ORG confirmed the verdict but reduced his fine to ORG . In DATE ORG dismissed his application for leave to appeal against conviction and sentence and his renewed application was rejected in DATE .

In DATE PERSON was convicted by an army district court - martial of disobeying a lawful command . He was sentenced to a severe reprimand and to a fine of LAW . ORG confirmed the verdict and sentence . In DATE ORG dismissed his application for leave to appeal against conviction and sentence and his renewed application was rejected in DATE .

The provisions of the Army Act DATE and of LAW DATE , which regulated army and air - force courts - martial prior to DATE , are set out in GPE v. GPE ( of DATE , Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-I , § § DATE ) and PERSON ORG ( judgment of DATE , Reports CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .

Following the adoption of the ORG 's report in the PERSON case ( no . DATE , Commission 's report of CARDINAL DATE ) , ORG came into force on DATE and significantly amended both DATE Acts . The relevant domestic law and practice applicable to air - force courts - martial following the entry into force of LAW is set out in the case of PERSON GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . MONEY , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINALXII ) . The relevant regulatory framework governing post-CARDINAL Act army courts - martial is the same in all material respects ( the ORG judgment , at § MONEY ) .
